Larry, please advise.  I don't remember my "solution."  My guess is that this has something to do with the driver management framework.  The framework creates a classloader for each driver definition, but the connection factory can use the driver definition to create a private instance of the classloader.  Using the shared classloader would help, but you'd still have problems if you were using more than one DB2 driver definition which used the same driver jar.
The recommended driver for connecting to DB2 is the DB2 Universal Driver (db2jcc.jar).  Supporting the DB2 Type 2 (aka. APP) driver is not a high priority.
Problem is not specific to db2.

I used plug-in crystal report in Eclipse . when i show report. i get a messaege "java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library ...\IBM\SQLLIB\BIN\db2jdbc.dll already loaded in another classloader"

The solution of IBM for Lotus :
In order for a Java agent to successfully use this driver a second time, the .dll should be added to the Notes program directory. 

In this case, the agent was being run manually from a client. The DB2 client was loaded in C:\SQLLIB\BIN. The Notes client was located in C:\Lotus\Notes. Copying the db2jdbc.dll from C:\SQLLIB\BIN to C:\Lotus\Notes resolved the problem. 
See: http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=0&uid=swg21114724
